snippet: Will its ruling in the health care case expunge judicial restraint from legal conservatism?
abstract: Editorial contends that the oral arguments before the Supreme Court on the constitutionality of the health care reform law should put to rest any idea that legal conservatives are dedicated to judicial restraint; cautions that, should the court strike down the law on partisan lines, the court will mark itself as driven by politics.
lead_paragraph: Will its ruling in the health care case expunge judicial restraint from legal conservatism?

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
